intro: Haloragis leucroides, commonly known as the white-flowered pondweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a submerged aquatic plant that typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats. The plant has small, white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and its leaves are narrow and grass-like. It plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various water organisms. Haloragis leucroides is often found in wetlands, lakes, and rivers, and it is adapted to tolerate fluctuating water levels.
